title: Guitar Lesson
description: This intermediate guitar lesson discusses Kessel's philosophy and pedagogy of how to improvise.
subject: Teaching; Pedagogy

title: Jazz Guitar Improvisation: Lesson 2 - Playing What You Know
description: Kessel uses his own terminology to teach interval relationships on the guitar.
subject: Teaching; Pedagogy

title: Progressive Concepts: Lesson 5 - How High the Blues
description: Kessel teaches an advanced chord progression on how to play the blues.
subject: Teaching; Pedagogy

title: Muskogee Souvenir Postcard
description: A souvenir folder from Muskogee, OK, postmarked July 17, 1944 at 10:30 AM. It depicts the sights and cultural heritage of Muskogee, OK, in fifteen full-color illustrations. Sent by a Mr. Omar Fleenor on May 30th of Scott City, KS, to Mr. and Mrs. H.W. Beilfuss of Clark County, IL. Intermediate ownership undetermined.
subject: Muskogee, OK; Biographical Information

title: 1963 Engagements
description: This overview of Kessel's 1963 appointments reflects his prolific performance activity in Hollywood circles. Many familiar names and studios appear in this list.
subject: Day Planners; Hollywood Years; Jazz Artist

title: Sailor On Dry Land
description: A 1971 description of Kessel for Cash Box magazine by Harvey Gellar. Interestingly, it's written in second-person.
subject: Reviews and Commentary; Legacy

title: The Barney Kessel Personal Manuscript Series #101-106
description: These four etudes are a part of Barney Kessel's Personal Manuscript Series. This series is a set of etudes written by Kessel. Each etude is focused on a different aspect of guitar playing. Aspects include alternate picking, position shifting, left-hand dexterity, and rhythmic patterns for pop, rock, and jazz music. Each etude also includes an explanation and tips written by Barney Kessel.
subject: Etudes; Pedagogy

title: Barney and the Basset
description: This photo is from apparently from a photo shoot in Sweden with photographer Robert Martin. It include Barney Kessel with his guitar, a basset hound, and a bowl of fruit.
subject: Photo Shoot; Basset Hound; Headshot

title: Close up of Barney Kessel with a guitar
description: This photo was taken by William Gullette, award-winning photographer and professor who lived in California. Based on the dates of his career, this photo was likely taken in like 1970s or later.
subject: Headshot

title: Photo from the 1976 European Tour with The Great Guitars
description: Barney Kessel, Charlie Byrd, and Herb Ellis formed The Great Guitars in 1973 and produced multiple live albums together. This photo is from their tour to Europe in 1976. Photo caption includes this note: Note that all three guitarists are playing a Barney Kessel Merson amplifier. Photo is by Ashley Summerfield from Ashley Mark Publishing Company.
subject: Jazz Artist; Legacy; Tour; Performance

title: Guitar Journal: Instilling Integrity
description: Barney Kessel writes about "charlatanism" in the music industr
subject: Reviews and Commentary; Pedagogy

title: Crescendo Article (April 1979)
description: Barney Kessel tells the readers of Crescendo, the Kent-based jazz magazine that ran for 47 years from July 1962 to Autumn 2009, his thoughts on the state of popular and jazz music in 1979.
subject: Reviews and Commentary; Jazz Artist

title: Crescendo Interview (October 1988)
description: Les Tomkins interviews Barney Kessel in 1988 for Crescendo, the Kent-based jazz magazine that ran for 47 years from July 1962 to Autumn 2009.
subject: Interview; Jazz Artist

title: A Note on Music Studies
description: Barney Kessel frequently wrote short ideas down in his notebook. Often they were related to his goals or ideas for songs or books, but sometimes they were simply memories or thoughts he had. This statement shows his ideas on music and his pedagogy.
subject: Pedagogy

title: Interview by Ian MacGregor
description: An interview from February 1992 while Kessel was visiting Perth, Australia. He speaks at length regarding his introduction to the guitar and his early career.
subject: Legacy; Interview

title: Barney Kessel in Newcastle
description: This is an outline of an improvisation workshop that Barney gave in Newcastle-upon-Tyne. For some reason, this pamphlet from Maurice Summerfield's contribution to the collection is printed in German.
subject: Workshop; Pedagogy
